Father Fermín Francisco de Lasuén was a Spanish Franciscan friar who played a crucial role in the establishment of missions in Alta California. He succeeded Father Junípero Serra as the president of the California missions and was responsible for founding several missions, including Mission Nuestra Señora de la Soledad.

Mission Nuestra Señora de la Soledad, founded on October 9, 1791, was the 13th mission in the California mission chain. It was dedicated to María de la Soledad (Our Lady of Solitude) and served as a center for religious conversion and agricultural development in the region.

With this enhanced understanding, we can confidently state that Father Fermín Francisco de Lasuén founded Mission Nuestra Señora de la Soledad, further highlighting his significant contributions to the mission chain in California.
